alert.note: Alert for South Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 1:44PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL LINCOLN COUNTY THROUGH 215 PM MDT... At 143 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alto, or 9 miles northeast of Ruidoso, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ruidoso, Ruidoso Downs, Capitan, Bonito Lake, Alto, Fort Stanton, Smokey Bear Historical Park, Nogal and Angus. This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 76 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
